alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Cumberland; Gloucester; Salem (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 2:16PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Atlantic, northern Cumberland, southern Salem and southeastern Gloucester Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 216 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Quinton, or 9 miles northwest of Bridgeton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Vineland, Millville, Bridgeton, Cumberland, Hammonton, Salem, Buena, Alloway, Weymouth, Quinton, Estell Manor, Newfield, Elmer, Greenwich, Shiloh, Elwood-Magnolia, Hancocks Bridge, Dorothy, Newport Meadows and Mays Landing. This includes Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 20 and 27. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
